reviewText: Serbian Scars is an intensely atmospheric piece.  There is a distinct visual style at play here.  Michael Madsen is at the top of his game as the protagonist.  The editing is top-notch, keeping the audience involved from the beginning frame.  The terrific multi-layered score also elevates the film.
The screen play was well written. The story moved along at a good pace. Lots of action. I enjoyed it.
